analysis.answer_to_prompt: This document satisfies the prompt requirements as a Brazilian M&A filing. It is a "Fato Relevante" (Material Fact) filed with the CVM on August 30, 2024, disclosing the merger by incorporation of multiple target companies (Timber VII SPE S.A., Timber XX SPE S.A., Pradaria Agroflorestal Ltda., Cabeceira Agroflorestal Ltda., and Frigg Florestal S.A.) into Suzano S.A. The document is 20+ pages and contains complete merger details including company information, transaction structure, benefits, appraisal reports, and governance, which is substantial M&A content. It qualifies as one of the required 2 Brazilian documents from public filings.
analysis.file_summary: Suzano S.A. Material Fact (Fato Relevante) filed with CVM on August 30, 2024, announcing the merger by incorporation of five wholly-owned target companies into Suzano S.A. The 20+ page document details the two-stage merger process, company backgrounds, transaction rationale aimed at administrative efficiency and corporate structure simplification, appraisal valuations totaling BRL 2.1 billion, and the Extraordinary General Meeting scheduled for September 30, 2024 to approve the mergers.
analysis.save_instructions: Save this PDF file using the naming convention: CompanyName_DocumentType_TransactionType_YYYY_MM_DD_CVM.pdf. The file should be saved as "Suzano_Fato_Relevante_Merger_2024_08_30_CVM.pdf". This follows the Brazilian filing convention for CVM Material Fact documents and includes the essential identifiers (company, document type, transaction type, date, and regulator).

analysis.answer_to_prompt: This document satisfies the prompt requirements as an American SEC filing. It is a definitive merger proxy statement (DEFM14A) filed with the SEC for the acquisition of Splunk Inc. by Cisco Systems, Inc. The document is from a public filing source (SEC EDGAR) and relates to an M&A transaction. While I cannot verify the exact page count from the extracted content, the extensive table of contents and document structure suggest it meets the ≥15 pages requirement typical for merger proxy statements. This would count as one of the two required American documents.
analysis.file_summary: SEC definitive merger proxy statement for the acquisition of Splunk Inc. by Cisco Systems through its subsidiary Spirit Merger Corp. The document details the $157.00 per share cash merger consideration, special meeting of stockholders on November 29, 2023, voting procedures, treatment of equity awards, regulatory approvals, fairness opinions from Qatalyst Partners and Morgan Stanley, and the full merger agreement as Annex A.
analysis.save_instructions: Save as SEC_MergerProxy_Splunk_Cisco_DEFM14A_2023.pdf following the SEC F-Year naming convention. The document should be retained as a PDF if available from SEC EDGAR, otherwise save as a markdown file (.md) with the same base filename. This counts as 1 of 2 required American M&A documents.

analysis.answer_to_prompt: This is a Brazilian CVM fato relevante filing from JBS S.A. dated April 22, 2025, detailing a dual listing transaction (Corporate restructuring to create JBS N.V. as holding company with NYSE and B3 listings). This constitutes an M&A/corporate restructuring document subject to shareholder approval. The document appears to be 17+ pages based on pagination, exceeding the 15-page requirement. It's from public filings (CVM) and contains detailed terms of the Incorporação de Ações (Share Merger) transaction, protocol and justification, financial details, and governance information. This meets the criteria for Brazilian CVM fatos relevantes relating to M&A activities.
analysis.file_summary: JBS S.A. fact about a dual listing corporate restructuring involving the creation of Dutch holding company JBS N.V. and a share merger (Incorporação de Ações). The 17-page document details the two-stage transaction: first establishing the holding structure through shareholder contributions, then implementing a share merger where JBS Participações will merge all non-held shares of JBS S.A. (2 shares for 1 redeemable share, then redeemed for BDRs representing Class A shares of JBS N.V.). Includes valuation report (R$44.78 billion), regulatory approvals in Brazil and US, corporate governance structure, dividend proposal (R$2.22 billion), and timeline for NYSE/B3 listings. Subject to approval at EGM on May 23, 2025.
analysis.save_instructions: Save as PDF using the naming convention: [Company]_[Country]_[DocumentType]_[Date]_[Description]_[Docket].pdf. Since no docket number is visible in the document, use "NO_DOCKET" placeholder. The document is 17 pages and meets the page count requirement. If PDF is not available, save as .md with same filename. The document contains both Portuguese and English versions of the same fact.

analysis.answer_to_prompt: This document is an SEC merger proxy statement (DEFM14A) filed by Sotherly Hotels Inc. for a merger with KW Kingfisher LLC's subsidiary Sparrows Nest LLC. It is from a public SEC filing (SEC Archives/EDGAR), American jurisdiction, and appears to be substantially longer than 15 pages based on the comprehensive table of contents showing sections A through B multiple pages. This satisfies one of the required 2 American M&A documents from public filings.
analysis.file_summary: SEC DEFM14A merger proxy statement for Sotherly Hotels Inc.'s acquisition by KW Kingfisher LLC through Merger Sub Sparrows Nest LLC. Document details $2.25 per share cash consideration, special meeting on January 22, 2026, financing arrangements with $47M equity commitment and $350M debt financing, board recommendations, financial advisor opinion from Piper Sandler, and comprehensive merger agreement terms including conditions, termination provisions, and treatment of securities.
analysis.save_instructions: Save using the format: COMPANYNAME_DOCUMENTTYPE_DATE_FORMNO_DOCKET.pdf.
